fields.description:
There is a code snipped in Driver class in compile method:

{noformat}
      if (conf.getBoolVar(ConfVars.HIVE_LOG_EXPLAIN_OUTPUT) ||
           conf.isWebUiQueryInfoCacheEnabled()) {
        String explainOutput = getExplainOutput(sem, plan, tree);
        if (explainOutput != null) {
          if (conf.getBoolVar(ConfVars.HIVE_LOG_EXPLAIN_OUTPUT)) {
            LOG.info("EXPLAIN output for queryid " + queryId + " : "
              + explainOutput);
          }
          if (conf.isWebUiQueryInfoCacheEnabled()) {
            queryDisplay.setExplainPlan(explainOutput);
          }
        }
      }
{noformat}

This is the stack trace

Now, in plain English, in the compile phase, hive is trying to generate explain output and set that output in the query display. Generating the explain output fails with OOM. 

I propose that setting of the explain output in query display be made optional, so that queries can still launch.
fields.summary: Launching big queries fails with Out of Memory Exception

comments.body: It is already already to be disabled via one of many flags.. like HIVE_LOG_EXPLAIN_OUTPUT=false, setting HIVE_SERVER2_WEBUI_PORT to 0, or  HIVE_SERVER2_WEBUI_MAX_HISTORIC_QUERIES=0, so wondering is it really necessary to have yet another flag for this?

Sorry I am not sure I follow, queryDisplay.setExplainPlan gets called only if HIVE_LOG_EXPLAIN_OUTPUT is true (first if), and then conf.isWebUIQueryInfoCacheEnabled (second if), so its effectively an && statement around queryDisplay.setExplainPlan(explainOutput);?
But current code is calling explain and storing it in the string, which is causing OOM - even though HIVE_LOG_EXPLAIN_OUTPUT is false.
We should check only for (conf.getBoolVar(ConfVars.HIVE_LOG_EXPLAIN_OUTPUT) for calling explain. The OR clause with web ui enabled should be removed.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12798655/HIVE-13500.patch
